tp:simple-type.name: Unix_Timestamp
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: An unsigned 32-bit integer representing time since 1970

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Bus_Name
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: A string representing a D-Bus bus name - either a well-known name like "org.freedesktop.Telepathy.MissionControl" or a unique name like ":1.123"

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Unique_Name
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: A string representing a D-Bus unique name, such as ":1.123"

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Interface
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: An ASCII string representing a D-Bus interface - two or more elements separated by dots, where each element is a non-empty string of ASCII letters, digits and underscores, not starting with a digit. The maximum total length is 255 characters. For example, "org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer".

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Signature
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: A string representing a D-Bus signature (the 'g' type isn't used because of poor interoperability, particularly with dbus-glib)

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Member
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: An ASCII string representing a D-Bus method, signal or property name - a non-empty string of ASCII letters, digits and underscores, not starting with a digit, with a maximum length of 255 characters. For example, "Ping".

tp:simple-type.name: DBus_Qualified_Member
tp:simple-type.tp:docstring: A string representing the full name of a D-Bus method, signal or property, consisting of a DBus_Interface, followed by a dot, followed by a DBus_Member. For example, "org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer.Ping".

tp:mapping.name: Qualified_Property_Value_Map
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A mapping from strings representing D-Bus properties (by their namespaced names) to their values.

tp:member.name: Key
tp:member.tp:docstring: A D-Bus interface name, followed by a dot and a D-Bus property name.

tp:mapping.name: String_Variant_Map
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A mapping from strings to variants representing extra key-value pairs.

tp:mapping.name: String_String_Map
tp:mapping.tp:docstring: A mapping from strings to strings representing extra key-value pairs.
